TITLE: Biden to Include Minimum Tax on Billionaires in Budget Proposal
SUMMARY: The tax would require that American households worth more than $100 million pay a rate of at least 20 percent on their income as well as unrealized gains in the value of liquid assets like stocks.

TITLE: The Fed Bets on a ‘Soft Landing,’ but Recession Risk Looms
SUMMARY: Central bankers have been clear that they will do what it takes to control inflation. They are betting on a soft landing, but a bumpy one is possible.

TITLE: Why the U.S. Can’t Quickly Wean Europe From Russian Gas
SUMMARY: The Biden administration’s plan to send more natural gas to Europe will be hampered by the lack of export and import terminals.

TITLE: Is America’s Economy Entering a New Normal?
SUMMARY: Policymakers are wrestling with the reality that the pandemic may mark a turning point in the nation’s economic plot.

TITLE: How 6 Workers Built New Careers In the Pandemic
SUMMARY: For some, the Covid-19 crisis presented an opportunity to change course. For each, it was a big risk on a new future.

TITLE: Biden Plans Sanctions on Russian Lawmakers as He Heads to Europe
SUMMARY: A chief goal of the meetings this week is to show that Russia’s invasion of Ukraine will not lead to sniping and disagreement among the United States and its allies.

TITLE: Ukraine War and Pandemic Force Nations to Retreat From Globalization
SUMMARY: Conflicts among the U.S., Russia and China — and endless Covid-19 outbreaks — strain the interdependent economy and Western ideas of post-Cold War stability.

TITLE: Will War Make Europe’s Switch to Clean Energy Even Harder?
SUMMARY: A wind turbine factory in Denmark and a coal mine in Poland illustrate the painful policy choices after Russia’s aggression in Ukraine added urgency to the transition to greener energy.

TITLE: Powell Says Fed Could Raise Rates More Quickly to Tame Inflation
SUMMARY: Jerome H. Powell, the chair of the Federal Reserve, voiced worry about inflation expectations and declared the central bank ready to do what it takes to control rapid price increases.

TITLE: As  Inflation Surges, Biden Targets Ocean Shipping
SUMMARY: The president is targeting shipping companies that have jacked up prices during the pandemic, but critics say bigger economic forces are at work.

TITLE: Speeches by the Fed chair and a measure of consumer sentiment: the week in business.
Stocks notch their best week since November 2020.
SUMMARY: Some of the pressures that had combined to sour once-ebullient markets seemed to be easing.

TITLE: U.S. warns servicing or refueling some Russian-owned planes may violate trade restrictions.
SUMMARY: Export controls introduced in late February prohibit exporting aircraft that were made in the U.S. or use some U.S. parts to Russia, effectively grounding some international flights, the Commerce Department said.

TITLE: Russia’s Central Bank Projects Economic Decline
SUMMARY: Inflation and “large-scale structural transformation” are ahead, as the bank held interest rates at 20 percent.

TITLE: Ukraine Energy Company C.E.O. Tries to Keep Lights On During War
SUMMARY: DTEK, a prominent Ukrainian power company, arranges for soldiers to escort its emergency repair crews to reach damaged transmission lines.

TITLE: How the War in Ukraine Could Slow the Sales of Electric Cars
SUMMARY: The price of nickel, an essential ingredient in most batteries, has soared because of fear that Russian supplies could be cut off.

TITLE: House Votes to Suspend Normal Trade Relations With Russia
SUMMARY: The bill, which still needs Senate approval, is the latest in a series of measures that lawmakers have passed to support Ukraine and punish Russia for its invasion.

TITLE: Mortgage Rates Hit 4 Percent for First Time in 3 Years
SUMMARY: The average rate on 30-year fixed mortgages dropped as low as 2.65 percent in January 2021.

TITLE: Bank of England Raises Rates for Third Time to Fight Inflation
SUMMARY: The bank on Thursday lifted its key interest rate to 0.75 percent, the third consecutive increase.

TITLE: Amid Invasion of Ukraine, I.R.S. Aims to Police Oligarch Sanctions
SUMMARY: It wants to add agents to a 3,000-person investigations unit to help crack down on attempts by Russian oligarchs to evade sanctions.
